caption.p: Erucic acid inhibits IAV-derived vRNA-induced apoptosis and inflammation. IAV-infected cells with erucic acid (0, 0.3, 0.6 and 0.9 mM) treatment were evaluated. (A) Flow cytometry analysis of apoptotic cells using annexin V/PI staining. Data are presented as the mean ± standard error of the mean, representative of three independent experiments. ∗ P < 0.05, ∗∗ P < 0.01 vs. IAV-infected. (B) Cleaved caspase-3 and PARP assessed by immunoblotting. vRNA- or cRNA-transfected cells with erucic acid (0, 0.3, 0.6 and 0.9 mM) treatment for 24 h were assessed. (C) Apoptosis analyzed by flow cytometry using annexin V/PI staining. Data are presented as the mean ± standard error of the mean, representative of three independent experiments. ∗ P < 0.05, ∗∗ P < 0.01 vs. vRNA-transfected (column 4). (D) Lysates were isolated and used in immunoblotting detection cleaved caspase-3 and PARP. (E) Immunoblotting and (F) Luminex assays were performed to determine the levels of signaling pathways, cytokines and chemokines. Data are presented as the mean ± standard error of the mean, representative of three independent experiments. ∗ P < 0.05, ∗∗ P < 0.01, ∗∗∗ P < 0.001 vs. vRNA-transfected (column 4). (G) Expression of COX-2 detected by immunoblotting. (H) ELISA assays detecting PGE2 levels. Data are presented as the mean ± standard error of the mean, representative of three independent experiments. ∗∗∗ P < 0.001 vs. vRNA-transfected (column 4).
